data.title: Hitshape
data.body:
Final part of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/6820, new shapes added: Circle, Capsule, Rectangle.

demonstration with arbitrary values:

```
MCV:
    Health:
        HP: 600
        Shape: Capsule
            Radius: 426
            Vertices: 0, -512, 0, 512
```

![hit-a](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1812087/10826815/731242ce-7e63-11e5-86be-14acc1f38463.jpg)
![hit-b](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1812087/10826817/7528691c-7e63-11e5-9f1b-6187294ecad2.jpg)

```
4TNK:
    Health:
        HP: 900
        Shape: Rectangle
            Vertices: -512, -512, 512, 512
```

```
AFLD:
    Health:
        HP: 1000
        Shape: Rectangle
            Vertices: -1280,-384, 1280, 1024
```

![hit-c](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1812087/10826822/7725fffe-7e63-11e5-94fa-6335382f45ea.jpg)

data.title: Next
data.body: Oktoberfest

data.title: Lower GDI medic self heal speed
data.body: Current self heal speed is way too fast (you need >3 e1 to kill one selfhealing medic)

data.title: Lower view range on Chinook?
data.body:
I notice a lot of players building Chinook's just to use them as a view extender as they're slightly cheaper then a Hind.
Do we want this behavior?

data.title: Fix base range circle not being shown during building placement
data.body:
Note that the range circle is drawn below the shroud, so be sure to explore a bit before testing. This matches the behaviour as seen in release-20150614.

Fixes #9784.

data.title: Gems patches with a "greener" gem
data.body:
If you watch this replay from RA95 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AFb-xgDDf7Q you can see one or two kind(s) of gem patches with a "greener" (diagonal) gem on it.
I don't see this patch in the OpenRA Map Editor and I don't remember seeing this in RA95 (I don't have the game right here to check), so is this patch missing from OpenRA or is this a modded RA95 ?
I also found this picture in the "MONEY MANAGEMENT" section of this page http://redalert1.com/skill.php :
![im1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8930382/10804199/8e46aa0a-7dc6-11e5-9397-31bd4d35f000.jpg)

data.title: Atreides Campaign 1a/b: Sandworms should not be present
data.body: There were no sandworms in the original campaign mission 1, but the openra missions include them. They should be removed.

data.title: Update the D2k wiki page
data.body:
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/wiki/Strategy-Guide-for-Dune-2000-Mod  now contains a ton of incorrect (outdated) information (like the Deviator tanks not working!).
With the coming of the release we should update the guide to not fool people.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/27764749-update-the-d2k-wiki-page?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Mark Tanya as uncrushable?
data.body:
I can't tell ya how many times I've had my Tanya crushed by a goddamn ore tuck while trying to go place C4 on a refinery. Lets just say she is smart enough to avoid bring crushed, okay? I mean why the hell are shock troopers uncrushable what makes them so special?

Would also be nice if she was made temporarily invulnerable to FRIENDLY fire when placing C4. A lot of "lol killed ur tanya accidentally XDDD" happening in team matches. Especially bad with shock troopers for some reason.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/27764274-mark-tanya-as-uncrushable?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Added Keyboard input filter to only register first key press.
data.body:
Fix for #9737 to prevent key repeats triggering command keys multiple times.

Currently holding keyboard short cut keys triggers every key repeat, this changes to only register on physical key press.

Closes #9737.

data.title: Units with minimum range can't find their way to shoot.
data.body:
Version: release-20150919

Steps to reproduce: Open an RA game, and build an artillery or V2 launcher. Place it directly next to an enemy building and order it to attack.

Expected behaviour: Unit will move away from the building until it is in range, and then attack.

Observed behaviour: Unit will move side to side a bunch but never attack.

data.title: Support reservation categories
data.body:
Aircraft should not reserve a pad if it only rearms them and they do not need more ammo.
The same should apply for a repair bay.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/27753908-support-reservation-categories?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Reserve fixes
data.body:
Probably fixes #9783 and strengthens the API slightly to help prevent this problem in future.

I have called out all potential behaviour changes inline for the attention of reviewers.

data.title: Fix upgrades in d2k not being producible
data.body: On current bleed, it stops at `READY` and never finishes.

data.title: When placing buildings the CY build circle does not appear
data.body:
Clicking on a CY draws the build circle, placing a building does not.

On bleed, RA.

data.title: Attempted to finalize an undisposed DisposableAction. heli (355) reserved fix (77)
data.body:
http://pastebin.com/zPePbUm8

git-549f8a9 RA

data.title: Fix Aircaft.IsMoving Check
data.body: Found this while reviewing #9777.

data.title: Game Camera control like Tiberium Wars
data.body: In Tiberium Wars, you can move the player camera, in the battlefield, pressing and keeping pressed the right mouse button. Then an arrow would appear and, accordingly to how much the player move the mouse, on the direction he/she likes, the camera would move in such direction, more and more quickly. I think this would been a bad idea, if implemented, especially how people are used to resort on this feature, in order to quickly take a look on the discovered battlefield areas.

data.title: Save game on Missions & AI controlled skirmish sessions
data.body: In the original TS/RA1 game you could save the state of the single-player mission. This feature, at this moment, is not implemented yet. And I take the opportunity to ask to extend it even for AI-controlled Skirmish game sessions.

data.title: Update
Chrono vortex
data.body:
Hi there,

In know this issue has been discussed and closed :
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/6615#issuecomment-151457459

But I juste want to add an element.

From what I read, the thing preventing the implementation of this Vortex is the complexity of the rendering.

However, as I stated it, the PS1 version of the Vortex is far more simpler. It appears as a kind of black cloud throwing Tesla thunders. Maybe because It was tough to render on the PS1 ?

If it can help, I'd do a capture of this to show you.

Also for the PS1, the Vortex used to disappear after a random time. And not always attack units.

For the PC version it seems It always attack and never disappears.

Both PS1 and PC version may appear randomnly around the map after chronoshift use.

As far as I remember PS1 version is less powerful.

So maybe the vortex feature can be created based on the PS1 version instead of the PC version ?

Regards.

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/27732104-chrono-vortex?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: calculate correct altitude with terrain elevation offset (aircraft repulsion)
data.body: Fixes the repulsion problem in ts

data.title: Make sandworms miss their food
data.body:
now while i was working out the hijacker-buff ... i had contact with a trait called "WarnProbability" which is basicly the chance to avoid getting crushed by ... i guess evading the vehicle ? anyway ... 

how about we add a trait similar to this , to d2k's vehicles ... could call it "WormProbability" ... and this value could be derived from the speed of the unit ... the faster the unit is , the higher is the chance of the worm "missing" his food ... still shooting out of the sand but not getting the unit ... 

and this trait is only active when the unit is actually moving ... 

this way , we could give even slower units ... like Harvesters and Tanks a second chance , as long as they are "moving" (preferable to the next stable underground)

data.title: Use verb-noun form of commands in make.ps1 instead of aliases
Settings menu seperate back/apply buttons
data.body:
Would be nice if the Settings menus had a back (Cancel) and Apply button.

The Apply button should be disabled until the changes have been made, when clicked apply changes.

The back button should only then return the to the previous menu not applying changes, even if the UI has changed state.

The reset (to default) button could also be a bit clearer showing it only affects the currently selected tab.

</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Fixed musicTab = null return value from GetOrNull<ButtonWidget>
data.body: Same as https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/9772 essentially to silence Coverity. This tab/button isn't really optional at all just like the others. Introduced by https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/9549.

data.title: Fixed filtersButton = null return value from GetOrNull<DropDownButtonWidget>
data.body: Another inconsistency from https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/9744. Not really a regression, but Coverity detects it, so I made this non-optional for a clearer crash if the chrome.yaml isn't adapted.

data.title: Implement D2k thumper
data.body:
Thumper replaces Medic.

`AttractsWorms` now only attracts them, while actors with `WormFodder` also get eaten.
